citations.narrative:
The indoor primary enclosure housing two squirrel monkeys was in need of cleaning. A thick layer of opaque brown/black
material was coating many of the wooden panels and diamond shaped lattice that made up the enclosure as well as the
elevated perch made of PVC tube. Black/brown staining could also be seen at certain areas on the top section of the
wooden side walls. The primates came into contact with all of the hard surfaces in need of cleaning. Lack of adequate
cleaning may lead to odors, pests, and the spread of disease in addition to animal discomfort. All hard surfaces with which
non-human primates come in contact must be spot-cleaned daily and sanitized at least once every two weeks or more
often if needed to prevent an excessive accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, and excreta. To be corrected by March
21, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
E GONZALEZ, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
3.75(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The indoor primary enclosure housing two squirrel monkeys was in need of cleaning. A thick layer of opaque brown/black 
material was coating many of the wooden panels and diamond shaped lattice that made up the enclosure as well as the 
elevated perch made of PVC tube. Black/brown staining could also be seen at certain areas on the top section of the 
wooden side walls. The primates came into contact with all of the hard surfaces in need of cleaning. Lack of adequate 
cleaning may lead to odors, pests, and the spread of disease in addition to animal discomfort. All hard surfaces with which 
non-human primates come in contact must be spot-cleaned daily and sanitized at least once every two weeks or more 
often if needed to prevent an excessive accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, and excreta. To be corrected by March 
21, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
E GONZALEZ, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
